edu.unm.health.biocomp.hscaf

Class ScaffoldTree

  • Object
    • ScaffoldTree

  • public class ScaffoldTree
extends Object
    Comprised of a set of hierarchical scaffolds each a Scaffold object. Each input molecule has an associated ScaffoldTree, a hierarchical tree of Scaffolds, the largest of which is the root scaffold (and the Bemis-Murko framework). The ScaffoldTree object does not contain the Scaffold objects, which may be contained in a ScaffoldSet or re-constructed from ScaffoldStore ScaffoldEntitys. The ScaffoldTree object also contains the Linkers and Sidechains for the input molecule, and a copy of the input molecule.
    [Implementation notes] Here are the steps in perceiving the scaffolds of an input molecule:
    1. ScaffoldTree constructor called by application with input molecule as parameter, and either a ScaffoldSet, ScaffoldStore or ScaffoldDB instance, which stores known scaffolds, for output to unique list, and to avoid re-analysis of previously encountered scaffolds, and thereby enhance performance.
    2. The application may elect to use ScaffoldStore, which uses BerkeleyDB, for large-ish datasets. ScaffoldSet in-memory storage is faster for small datasetsbut may exhaust available memory for large datasets. For large (> 100k compounds) jobs, or for directly populating a database, ScaffoldDB can be used, but requires an available database server.
    3. For each input molecule, a complete ScaffoldTree is built. When ScaffoldSet is used, the ScaffoldTree references Scaffold instances which are contained in the ScaffoldSet. When ScaffoldStore is used, all Scaffold instances must be re-constructed from ScaffoldEntity objects. When ScaffoldDB is used, all Scaffold instances must be re-constructed from ScaffoldRecord objects.
    4. The perception of scaffolds from a molecule is accomplished by:
      • hscaf_utils.tagJunctions() - tags junction bonds
      • hscaf_utils.findChildScaffolds() - breaks one junction bond, then analyzes each part as candidate scaffold, then recurse for each part until no more junctions.

    Author:
    Jeremy J Yang
    See Also:
    Linker, Scaffold, Linker, Sidechain, hscaf_utils, ScaffoldStore, ScaffoldEntity, ScaffoldDB, ScaffoldRecord

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScaffoldTree(Molecule mol, boolean keep_nitro_attachments, boolean stereo)
      No ScaffoldStore, no ScaffoldSet, no ScaffoldDB.
      ScaffoldTree(Molecule mol, boolean keep_nitro_attachments, boolean stereo, ScaffoldDB scafdb)
      ScaffoldDB used for storage.
      ScaffoldTree(Molecule mol, boolean keep_nitro_attachments, boolean stereo, ScaffoldSet scafset)
      ScaffoldSet used for storage.
      ScaffoldTree(Molecule mol, boolean stereo, boolean keep_nitro_attachments, ScaffoldSet scafset, ScaffoldStore scafstore, ScaffoldDB scafdb)
      Create ScaffoldTree by analyzing input molecule. All scaffolds will be found and associated with the root scaffold, a.k.a. the Bemis-Murko framework. If input molecule is multi-fragment, throw exception. Either (1) ScaffoldSet, (2) ScaffoldStore, or (3) ScaffoldDB used as a lookup to avoid re-analysis of previously analyzed scaffolds.
      ScaffoldTree(Molecule mol, boolean keep_nitro_attachments, boolean stereo, ScaffoldStore scafstore)
      ScaffoldStore used for storage.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ArrayList<Scaffold> getAllScaffolds()
      Returns list of all scaffolds, not deduplicated. Note that although the child scaffolds for each Scaffold are unique, for a set there may be duplicates in the hierarchy.

      Returns count of all leaf scaffolds, deduplicated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScaffoldTree

        public ScaffoldTree(Molecule mol,
            boolean stereo,
            boolean keep_nitro_attachments,
            ScaffoldSet scafset,
            ScaffoldStore scafstore,
            ScaffoldDB scafdb)
             throws SearchException,
                    MolFormatException,
                    MolExportException,
                    ScaffoldException,
                    IOException
        Create ScaffoldTree by analyzing input molecule. All scaffolds will be found and associated with the root scaffold, a.k.a. the Bemis-Murko framework. If input molecule is multi-fragment, throw exception. Either (1) ScaffoldSet, (2) ScaffoldStore, or (3) ScaffoldDB used as a lookup to avoid re-analysis of previously analyzed scaffolds.
        Parameters:
        mol - input molecule
        keep_nitro_attachments - true for N-attachments scaf definition
        stereo - stereo scaffolds (default non-stereo)
        scafset - in-memory lookup table
        scafstore - BerkeleyDB for lookup table
        scafdb - RDB for lookup table
        Throws:
        SearchException
        MolFormatException
        MolExportException
        ScaffoldException
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getScaffolds

        public ArrayList<Scaffold> getScaffolds()
        Returns list of all scaffolds, deduplicated. Note that although the child scaffolds for each Scaffold are unique, for a set there may be duplicates in the hierarchy, thus this method must deduplicate.

      • getAllScaffolds

        public ArrayList<Scaffold> getAllScaffolds()
        Returns list of all scaffolds, not deduplicated. Note that although the child scaffolds for each Scaffold are unique, for a set there may be duplicates in the hierarchy.
